openTweetMessage.label: Open Tweet__Message.txt
openTweetMessage.tooltip:
Opens the 'Tweet_Message.txt' which is the content of the message for Twitter.
Available parameters inside the file:
$message = The value of the 'Message for Tweet' textfield
$url = Your URL to twitch.tv/<your channelname>
$title = Current Title on Twitch
$game = Current Game on Twitch
$preview = your stream preview image (generated by Twitch)

cbTweetWhenGoingLive.label: AutoTweet when going live
cbTweetWhenGoingLive.tooltip: Want the bot to automatically send out a Tweet when going live?

txtTweetContent.value: Optional textfield to use in the Message
txtTweetContent.label: Quick Message for Tweet File
txtTweetContent.tooltip: This textfield can be used inside the TweetMessage.txt as '$message' parameter. Simply for quick usage.

cbTweetContent.label: Enable Optional textfield
cbTweetContent.tooltip: This enable Optional Textfield from Tweet File option. If this is not checked, the '$message' parameter into Tweet File will be replaced with nothing.

sliderNewTweetWaiting.label: Waiting timer (seconds)
sliderNewTweetWaiting.tooltip:
How long does it waits at least (indicatively) before posting a new Tweet?
Doesn't count when you click "Send Tweet Manually" button and on Periodic tweets (if you setted any).
If "On Game Change" triggers, remember it could take up to 5 minutes more: the time needed by the script to notice the game is changed.

sliderNewTweetAfterBreak.label: Offline timer (minutes)
sliderNewTweetAfterBreak.tooltip: How long does your stream have to be offline before the script recognizes it as a new stream and sends a new Tweet out?

txtTwitchChannelName.label: Streaming Channel Name
txtTwitchChannelName.tooltip: This will be used only as workaround in case the ChatBot fails to retrieve the Channel Name by itself.

cbTwitchChannelName.label: Force Streaming Channel Name
cbTwitchChannelName.tooltip:
If this is checked, the above Streaming Channel Name will be always used (if you setted any).
This means the script will not try to get Channel Name from chatbot runtime libraries.

txtGenericStreamName.label: Generic livestream title
txtGenericStreamName.tooltip:
This sentence will be used as title into your tweet only if no Streaming Channel Name was found.
Which mean you left the Streaming Channel Name empty and the script didn't succeed to get it from chatbot on runtime.

txtGenericGameName.label: Generic game name
txtGenericGameName.tooltip:
This sentence will be used as game name into your tweet only if no Streaming Channel Name was found.
Which mean you left the Streaming Channel Name empty and the script didn't succeed to get it from chatbot on runtime.

txtTwitterChannelName.label: Twitter Channel Name
txtTwitterChannelName.tooltip: This will be used only as workaround in case your Twitter user details are unreachable via API.

cbTwitterChannelName.label: Force Twitter Channel Name
cbTwitterChannelName.tooltip:
If this is checked, the above Twitter Channel Name will be always used (if you setted any).
This means the script will not try to get Channel Name from Twitter Free API.

resetTwitterChannelName.label: Reset Twitch Channel Name
resetTwitterChannelName.tooltip: Delete current saved Twitch Channel Name from memory and tries to get a new one.

cbPostTweetInChat.label: Post Message with TweetUrl in Chat
cbPostTweetInChat.tooltip: If you want the Bot write a message after Tweeting with the URL to the Tweet so people can RT/like it.

txtTweetLinkInChat.label: Chatmessage
txtTweetLinkInChat.tooltip:
Message which the bot posts in chat after sending the Tweet out.
$tweetUrl = Link to Twitter Message

cbPostMsgMultipleTimes.label: Post the Message multiple times
cbPostMsgMultipleTimes.tooltip: If you want the Bot to write the message multiple times after going live.

sliderRTInterval.label: Interval (min)
sliderRTInterval.tooltip: Set the time between each time the bot should post the message in minutes.

sliderRTAmount.label: Amount of times
sliderRTAmount.tooltip: Set the amount of times the bot should post the message.

cbSendNewTweetOnGameChange.label: Send new Tweet when game changes
cbSendNewTweetOnGameChange.tooltip: Sends a new Tweet using the text from the 'Tweet_OnGameChange.txt' file when the streamer changes the game (only works for twitch streamers).

openTweetOnGameChange.label: Open Tweet__OnGameChange.txt
openTweetOnGameChange.tooltip:
Opens the 'Tweet_OnGameChange.txt' which is the content of the message for Twitter.
Leave empty and it will use the TweetMessage.txt
Available parameters inside the file:
$message = The value of the 'Message for Tweet' textfield
$url = Your URL to twitch.tv/<your channelname>
$title = Current Title on Twitch
$game = Current Game on Twitch
$preview = your stream preview image (generated by twitch)

cbPeriodicTweeting.label: Post a Tweet periodically while live
cbPeriodicTweeting.tooltip: If enabled, the script will send a new tweet using the text from the 'Tweet_Periodic.txt' file.

buttonOpenPeriodicTextFile.label: Open Tweet__Periodic.txt
buttonOpenPeriodicTextFile.tooltip: Sends out a new Tweet using the text from the 'Tweet_Periodic.txt' file in a set interval.

sliderPeriodicTweetInterval.label: Interval (mins)
sliderPeriodicTweetInterval.tooltip: Set the interval in minutes that need to pass before the script sends out a new tweet using the text from the Tweet_Periodic.txt file.

txtPathPython.label: Python Path
txtPathPython.tooltip: Enter the path to your default Python27 directory (per default: 'C:\Python27\python.exe')

btnInstallPipRequets.label: Install pip requests
btnInstallPipRequets.tooltip: Click this button to execute the command line 'python -m pip install requests requests_oauthlib' to install necessary libraries

btnRegisterTwitterApp.label: Register Twitter App
btnRegisterTwitterApp.tooltip: Click this button to register your App for Twitter and get the Consumer-/Access information.

txtConsumerKey.label: Consumer Key
txtConsumerKey.tooltip: Your consumer key from the twitter app link.

txtConsumerSecret.label: Consumer Secret
txtConsumerSecret.tooltip: Your consumer secret from the twitter app link.

txtAccessToken.label: Access Token
txtAccessToken.tooltip: Your access token from the twitter app link.

txtAccessTokenSecret.label: Access Token Secret
txtAccessTokenSecret.tooltip: Your access token secret from the twitter app link.

cbLoggingToScriptLogs.label: Post logs to script log
cbLoggingToScriptLogs.tooltip:
Logs info to script log when the script attempts to send out new tweets or removes old tweets sent by the bot.
Errors will always be logged.
